TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> Just now, Ben J. Kerman said:
> 
> 
> What is going on with the "Don't Click" Thread? I don't want it to be un-locked, I don't really care, but it seems like it has been locked, unlocked, locked, unlocked, and locked for a while, and it seems like even you (The moderators) are surprised. It has just been unlocked again somehow.
> 

You are mistaken.

Ok. Wait, mistaken about what? I just saw that someone commented on the Don't Click, and I am pretty sure that it was locked yesterday. If you mean about how you don't know what is happening, then I apologize, you know a lot more than me (About the forums, about life, etc.) I am just a little confused. If that is going too much into rule 3.3, then I am sorry, I don't want to cause any trouble.

> 
> 
> Just now, Ben J. Kerman said:
> 
> 
> Ok. Wait, mistaken about what? I just saw that someone commented on the Don't Click, and I am pretty sure that it was locked yesterday. If you mean about how you don't know what is happening, then I apologize, you know a lot more than me (About the forums, about life, etc.) I am just a little confused. If that is going too much into rule 3.3, then I am sorry, I don't want to cause any trouble.
> 

It's a running joke.  It started long before I came on, so I don't know exactly what happened, but we do unlock/lock it frequently and the joke is that it's never been unlocked.  The locking system on that thread works perfectly fine.  It's just toggled.... a lot.

> 
> 
> 15 hours ago, Vanamonde said:
> 
> 
> The very first account created is Jeb's.
> 

That's not actually true, [@Jebediah Kerman](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/109744-jebediah-kerman/)'s user number is 109744. The earlier user number is 3, which belongs to [@aLeXmOrA](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/3-alexmora/). My guess is that some administrator played with the join dates to put the official accounts first. I don't know what happened to accounts 1 or 2, but they've probably been lost to the sands of time.

I have fun trolling the other moderators. I visit it every once in a while and unlock it. Oh, and there are times I will randomly lock it again. It's just become a forum game anyway. And that's the way it should be - kinda like a good gumbo. If it's really good, you enjoy it while you can; you never know when you'll get another opportunity to have another good batch of gumbo. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
I think I get it now. You lock and unlock it frequently, but to make it funnier you insist that it has always been locked, making people confused. Got it. Thank you!!

>

> 1 minute ago, Ben J. Kerman said:
> 
> 
> I think I get it now. You lock and unlock it frequently, but to make it funnier you insist that it has always been locked, making people confused. Got it. Thank you!!
> 

No, it's been locked since Ted locked it in 2013. The other moderators are messing with your head. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

>

> 5 minutes ago, Ben J. Kerman said:
> 
> 
> ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D") It's good to know that the moderators have a good sense of humor! This will be my last post about that thread so we can keep this thread on topic.
> 

Some of us have a very strong sense of humor. I, for one, have to tone down my humor and sarcasm here on this forum. Between graduate school (I have a Ph.D. and working on the second one), and nearly 8 years in the military, my sense of humor and sarcasm skills are closely intertwined. ![:blush:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_embarrassed.gif ":blush:") ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif ":cool:")

If you know me, you know I have a very good sense of humor/sarcasm. Almost *too* good...

To continue this thread in the right direction with a different question, in the moderator UI that was posted on page 231, what does the triangle with exclamation mark (Warning sign? I don't know how to describe that symbol) mean, and what does "ModeratorCP" mean? If that is classified information, I sort of understand.

> 
> 
> 11 minutes ago, Ben J. Kerman said:
> 
> 
> To continue this thread in the right direction with a different question, in the moderator UI that was posted on page 231, what does the triangle with exclamation mark (Warning sign? I don't know how to describe that symbol) mean, and what does "ModeratorCP" mean? If that is classified information, I sort of understand.
> 

The "warning sign" and is the icon for the moderator control panel. It's a link that opens the moderator area. 

Just as with the normal notification bell, we get a white number in a small red circle to let us know there are a corresponding number of things that need attention.

We get a notification when a post is in the newbie queue, when a post is reported, and so forth. I cannot go into more detail than that, sorry.

![LI0uduu.png](https://i.imgur.com/LI0uduu.png)
The first forum game was posted on December 31st 1969. Unless some dude is magical and made this happen by going back in time why is this?

> 
> 
> 8 minutes ago, Stormpilot said:
> 
> 
> The first forum game was posted on December 31st 1969. Unless some dude is magical and made this happen by going back in time why is this?
> 

Errors accumulated in the multiple forum upgrades, plus that's the first date that the system recognizes IIRC.

> 
> 
> 56 minutes ago, Dman979 said:
> 
> 
> Errors accumulated in the multiple forum upgrades, plus that's the first date that the system recognizes IIRC.
> 

It's the UNIX EPOCH.

On UNIX, the timestamp 0x000000000000000 is January 1st, 1970 0:00:00.000 Zulu (GMT-0 - or Greenwich Time). Since USA is some hours earlier than Zulu (East Cost Time is GMT-5), **January 1st, 1970 0:00 Zulu** is **December 31st 1969 19:00** on the USA's East Cost.

The server hosting Forum is probably on USA, so this explains this date: the posts got their timestamp zeroed (the default value for most uninitialised data), then it was converted to a ISO 8601 datetime localised to some USA time zone.

> 
> 
> 4 minutes ago, Lisias said:
> 
> 
> It's the UNIX EPOCH.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> On UNIX, the timestamp 0x000000000000000 is January 1st, 1970 0:00:00.000 Zulu (GMT-0 - or Greenwich Time). Since USA is some hours earlier than Zulu (East Cost Time is GMT-5), **January 1st, 1970 0:00 Zulu** is **December 31st 1969 19:00** on the USA's East Cost.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> The server hosting Forum is probably on USA, so this explains this date: the posts got their timestamp zeroed (the default value for most uninitialised data), then it was converted to a ISO 8601 datetime localised to some USA time zone.
>
